org.qdwizard

Class Wizard

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.event.WindowAdapter
      • org.qdwizard.Wizard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActionListener, WindowFocusListener, WindowListener, WindowStateListener, EventListener

    public abstract class Wizard
extends WindowAdapter
implements ActionListener
    A Wizard dialog displaying one or more screens
    • Create a class that extends Wizard. You have to implement getPreviousScreen(), getNextScreen() and finish() abstract methods
    • Displaying the wizard:
      •  {

      • getPreviousScreen

        public abstract Class<? extends Screen> getPreviousScreen(Class<? extends Screen> screen)
        Gets the previous screen class.
        Parameters:
        screen - reference screen for which we want the previous screen class.
        Returns:
        previous screen class relatively to screen or null if there is no screen before screen.

      • resetScreens

        public final void resetScreens()
        Clear screens history, all screens are dropped along with their data and will be recreated in future use.

      • getNextScreen

        public abstract Class<? extends Screen> getNextScreen(Class<? extends Screen> screen)
        Gets the next screen class.
        Parameters:
        screen - reference screen for which we want the next screen class.
        Returns:
        next screen class relatively to screen or null if there is no screen after screen.

      • getCurrentScreen

        public Class<? extends Screen> getCurrentScreen()
        Get current screen.
        Returns:
        current screen class

      • updateGUIState

        public void updateGUIState()
        Refresh buttons and problems. Called asynchronously by the screens or by the wizard itself.

      • finish

        public abstract void finish()
        Finish action. Called when user clicks on "finish"

      • onCancel

        public boolean onCancel()
        Called when user clicks on "cancel". Override it if you want to do something in cancel such as display a confirmation dialog.

        Returns:
        return true if the Wizard should continue to close return false if the Wizard should abort the cancellation
